segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on drying that plate, she doesn’t see anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and she doesn’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle, but she’s acting like it’s not even there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just really tired or if she’s ignoring the mess on purpose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no idea what’s going on behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and the girl is just waiting for a cookie like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like someone needs to warn them before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so upset when she finally notices the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and they’re going to be in so much trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR
